data.title: Fantastic!
data.text: Big portions. Fresh taste. Friendly staff. For 2 people we over ordered but it was so delicious that we couldn't help ourselves. The wontons were peculiar though without any filling although there is a cheese filled type. Interesting. Lunch dishes seem to come with rice so you don't have to order extra rice. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in LA. Highly recommended.

data.title: Good general tso's and great service
data.text: Daughter didn't care for her tofu dish but the service was good, atmosphere pleasant and a really nice pre-theater meal. I was surprised to find chairs stores in the handicapped bathroom but space is a premium downtown. The wonton noodles and sweet sauce were yummy

data.title: Late dinner
data.text: This place delivers for only $2, not bad for dtla. I actually picked up my food,  they were open later than the other Chinese restaurants so I gave them a try.  Their prices are between $2-5 higher than other Chinese restaurants in the area with better reviews so I was a little skeptical.  I had shrimp Fried rice and orange chicken.  They were both tasty and decent size portions.  My only complaint was that there were only exactly 6 shrimp in my rice.  I paid extra for shrimp so I expected a little more than that.  I plan to try a few other places in the area,  definitely a Chinese food fix if you are looking for one late. They got 4 stars from because the customer service was great.  They were really nice and accommodating,  and if I had to choose between them and place with better food and horrible service I will patronize the restaurant that appreciates my business.

data.title: Not a traditional Chinese food
data.text: Liliya Chinese Bistro is the western style fast food. Maybe look like Chinese food but definitely not TRADITINAL Chinese food ever. But still good ! I like it ! Just do got wrong way for the food style !

data.title: Excellent chinese
data.text: The place looks very low-key and you might easily pass it from the street. While the interior decoration is very basic, the food is excellent. Menu is not huge, but we tried several different things and all were great. Waitress efficient though not particularly kind. Good place to go with kids as well - excellent value-for-money.

data.title: Tamales
data.text:
I first heard of this place when my brother in law was working right next to the Liliya China Bistro as a guard and front desk person of the apartment complex that is right next to it. He had gotten to know the people that worked there and he once gave them my mom's tamales (which they loved) and in return exchanged it for some of their dishes. 

Ever since then, I got to know them a little, joked around with them and dined with them. I came to find them to be a warm people, especially during the holidays. Smiles abound all around and the diner looked clean and beautiful.

but I digress.

The food here is amazing, literally the best Asian cuisine I've ever had in LA, and I should know, I've lived in LA all my life. I've gone here and there for different Asian cuisines, but none have come close to the superb quality of service and food like Liliya China Bistro. 

Every time I have business with someone, or I just want to invite a friend or friends to eat, I invite them here.

The menu is great and very wide, the service is quick and the food is beyond my understanding.

One of the things noted about this place is that it has a bar where you can watch the games as well. Plus it is right next to a club scene right next to it, where you see the wonderful people pass you by, but there are no loud noises to bother you while you dine with your friends, or perhaps a wonderful date you have for the night. ;p

I love the area of this place, because after eating a lot, you can walk around the wonderfully made police station, and there's a park right across the street where people sometimes take their dogs and play with them, train them, and come together. 

All in all, this place was put in a wonderful setting, the food and ambiance is warm, and it's such a strange combination of warmness and party.

I highly recommend this place, for business, friends, or dates with your loved one.

Maybe if you get to know them on a constant basis, you could bring tamales and tell them that its for them to enjoy. Don't do it expecting something in return, but if they know you, then maybe you'll get a treat, from this wonderful cuisine known as Liliya China Bistro.

Enjoy :D

data.title: Hidden treasure
data.text: If your in a car you could easily pass this place. Nice staff good place to eat not very expensive either. I have the veggie egg rolls, pork pot stickers, and miso soup everything I was hoping for.  Personally I think that if you get both switch the sauces I loved them that way.

data.title: Amazing!! Specially for vegetarian!!
data.text: This place is awesome!! As a vegetarian it is always very card to find proper non-fast food in the US and specially a variety. This place has much much to offer and everything is SO YAMMY!! Service is great, food is great all that's left is to find a great company :) prices btw are absolutely reasonable

data.title: Fast, tasty lunch
data.text: I can't speak to their dinner menu but we have eaten here twice on business nearby. The food is tasty, not fabulous, they serve you in a timely manner, are friendly & the place is clean-perfect quick, sit down lunch in a busy city....enjoy!

data.title: Pinot Grigio, Bulgogi, Tofu Eggplants, and Cheesecake
data.text: I like a warm friendly restaurant that serves healthy tasty food.  I like a reasonably priced meal that satisfies the tummy.  I like a place where I could hear my friends chat.  I like a menu with wine and other choice fixings including desert for any mood and hunger.  I like a clean restaurant restroom.  I like cute waiters.  For dinner in the emptiness of afterhour downtown LA, I like a homey neighborhood restaurant.  My friends and I don't even think anymore, it's always Liliya, even on consecutive nights when we can.   Liliya is a gem.

data.title: Good Chinese in Downtown Los Angeles
data.text:
Lili Ya's is right across the street from the new LAPD HQ, on 2d almost at the corner with Main.  I have only eaten lunch there and then only a couple of times.  Both meals were very good.

I went on a Friday in Lent.  I had a shrimp and vegetables dish, the name of which escapes me now.  The food was hot, the vegetables warm and crisp, and the shrimp very good sized and there were several of them.  It is a diner-style place with booths along the windows.  They make an excellent iced tea.  Lunch with iced tea and tip ran me about $12.  If you are looking for atmosphere, this is not your place, but if you are looking for an inexpensive lunch in downtown, Lili Ya's is the ticket.

data.title: neighborfriend mako & i...
data.text: neighborfriend mako & i just shared their chicken lettuce cups and eggplant with tofu...ingredients and preparation are lighter, fresher than their oily and ordinary chinatown cousins.  excellent service, as well...

data.title: Ottimo cibo cinese per qualità e convenienza
data.text: Ottimo, cibo cinese di qualità e porzioni abbondanti. Ambiente tranquillo e locale pulito, servizio attento. Abbiamo preso due antipasti di involtini primavera (4 ciascuna portata) e due piatti di noodles, uno vegetariano ed uno con pollo: viste le porzioni ne sarebbero bastate la metà. Inoltre ci hanno portato della verdura. In tutto abbiamo speso circa 30 dollari. Consigliato.
